ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Doubt about different Moodle languages
ResponsesInList.Text:
No, Moodle does not differ from one language to another. It is the same software no matter what language the site or course or user may be using. The function remains the same whichever language it may be shown in. All the standard "strings" included with Moodle which show buttons, navigation, menus, settings, help, and so forth can be changed from one language to another at several levels using "Language packs". They can be further customised on your site, as well. Please see the documentation on Language for the details. Any
content you add to a Moodle site will be in whatever language the content is written or made with. Moodle does not translate or otherwise change the language of content you add.
Moodle's language packs only change the wording for the standard
navigation and other included features. If you have more questions about how the languages work in Moodle, including running a Moodle site using multiple language, then please take a look at the documentation pages and also the Languages forum for support . This site is a support site about Moodle, which has communities in several languages. The forums on this site dedicated to certain languages are simply forums created for users to speak with one another in a particular language. The "Moodle in English" forums, including this one, are for use in English. If you want to get support, ask or answer questions, or chat with people in another language on this site, you can join one of the forums specifically for speakers of that language.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Diversify access and viewing of courses for registered users (internal and external)
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi The difference between internal and external users needs a clarification. Do you mean when somebody logs in from the LAN, usually from private IP addresses like 10.x.x.x, he is internal and if the address is from the Internet he is external? Or, people who are attached to your institution, usually the e-mail belongs to your domain or authenticated by your LDAP are internal and all the others external?

ResponsesInList.Title: Ri: Re: Diversify access and viewing of courses for registered users (internal and external)
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Visvanath Internal: access via web with LDAP and two-factor authentication with access to all content. External: they will not be able to register via web (they will always be enrolled manually) and will access with Moodle login + 2-factor authentication (Google auth): they should access viewing only courses defined / categorized for external (e.g. creating a category or more). The goal is to diversify access to courses... but I know Moodle was not designed for this.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Ri: Re: Diversify access and viewing of courses for registered users (internal and external)
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi OK. Unless I am not missing something there is a simple answer. Internal: Keep the current authentication and enrollment procedure.

ResponsesInList.Title: Ri: Re: Ri: Re: Diversify access and viewing of courses for registered users (internal and external)
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, the main problem is that it's a matter of managing the "course access split" at the authentication level, not at the course enrollment level. In fact, there is no guest access but authentication is always required. In the platform there are several courses with different methods of enrollment and some of these courses (regardless of the method of enrollment) should not be "visible" to external users, but only to internal ones. While those who authenticate manually (external) should only be able to see a defined set of courses. The web publication would then provide accessible courses, divided as follows: 1) Only to internal users 2) Internal and external users 3) External only A simple solution would be to use two different platforms, but it would become challenging to manage the content...

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Ri: Re: Ri: Re: Diversify access and viewing of courses for registered users (internal and external)
ResponsesInList.Text: OK. There is some logic, which I can't grab. It goes in circles around site-wide (authentication) and course-wide (authorization), visibility (externals not even seeing the names of the h courses), activity-level (seeing/participation control). No sorry, I have no idea. Still believe that the subject is enrollment. May be people there can help.

ResponsesInList.Title: Logs by role
ResponsesInList.Text: Just a short proposal below; I often use the logs feature to get an overview of how students are doing with courses - especially ones that are rarely visited, however it's often swamped with teacher/site admin logs which aren't particularly helpful. Adding a filter by role to the logs page would be very useful.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Logs by role
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Benjamin, Adding this will be much more complex than it seems. The roles are integrated in Moodle in many ways and levels, so if you need to filter by role, then on what level? and what if you are not using roles on that level. Moodle has good activity completion reporting: https://docs.moodle.org/311/en/Activity_completion_report OR look at course logs, it will be more on focused and less sitewide admin clutter. You can also look at creating some custom reporting on specific information you need.

ResponsesInList.Title: Add warning when image is pasted in forum thread that it won't be available
ResponsesInList.Text: My students use the forum extensively to help each other, ask questions, etc ... Often they take a screenshot of their issue to paint a clearer picture for the forum readers. In the editor of the person that creates the post, this screenshot image can be pasted. It is then visible to the poster. But when what is in the editor is actually submitted to be published on Moodle, these pasted images are lost. Students only realise this after their classmates or teachers start posting questions such as "which screenshot are you reffering to?" Either make the pasting of images in the forum text editor impossible, or generate a warning that pasted images are not automatically uploaded to Moodle and shall not be shown to others.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Add warning when image is pasted in forum thread that it won't be available
ResponsesInList.Text: I believe that this problem has been fixed in a more recent version of Moodle. What version are you running?

ResponsesInList.Title: return function - sending messages to selected users
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello. I work as a professor and I use our university`s Moodle website to send messages (invitations for distance learning classes) to students. The groups of students are not specified by our moderators as soon as groups are changing every 3-5 months, so each student just marks his group in the profile and I have to use the search function to find groups .  Before, I could send messages to users that were found in search section. After an update, this function disappeared as well as other searching features. So, now I have to write to each student separately which makes sending invitations much longer and, I suppose, increases the load on server . Could you, please, return the 'sending to selected students' function? Thank you!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: return function - sending messages to selected users
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Your Moodle site is badly designed. You need to "group" people somehow. There are many approaches: - make a course per group and enrol the group in the course - make a course per class, enrol them and build groups within the course - group them sitewide, called cohorts - etc The administration need not to group every student. There are ways to get the students to enrol/group themselves - some need additional plug-ins like Group choice . Univ. students are mature enough for some "self organization".

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: return function - sending messages to selected users
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, Visvanath Ratnaweera, thank you. In my message I wrote that groups are changing constantly so it would be problematic to regroup them each time. Thus, it would be much better if searching functionality, namely sending a message to selected found users, would be returned back in further versions of Moodle.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: return function - sending messages to selected users
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: return function - sending messages to selected users
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, Visvanath Ratnaweera, thank you for your response. All I know is that the Moodle version is 3.10. It is fine that you didn't use this function, I am pretty sure that this work-flow was disabled by Moodle developers. I just tried to reach them (Moodle developers) here to ask them to return back this function. And, as I see, they don't respond here.

ResponsesInList.Title: Group Enrollment Keys and Bespoke Landing Pages
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi All, I am trying to set up a system that will allow me to: Enroll groups with their own unique enrollment key Automatically send group users to their own branded landing page, based on their group enrollment profile. I have seen how group enrollment keys might work, but cannot find anything current on how to auto-redirect individuals to their group page, based on their profile. There seemed to be  "Profile Redirect" option once, but that seems to have disappeared. Any suggestions as to how I could set this up please? Many thanks Greg

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Group Enrollment Keys and Bespoke Landing Pages
ResponsesInList.Text: You could consider using the Generico filter on the Front page text area as a means of achieving this. It allows you present different content to different users based on information stored in their profile, either the standard fields (institution, department, etc.) or custom profile fields. It might also allow you redirect to another page automatically using JavaScript . See https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=324771#p1584679 for example. Generico in your case would require HTML + CSS + JavaScript + SQL , so its a bit tricky to set up.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Group Enrollment Keys and Bespoke Landing Pages
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Eoin. Thanks very much for that. I'll look in to your suggestion . . . . .although I was hoping to avoid "a bit tricky to set up", since I find most of the "standard" things in Moodle a bit tricky! Whatever happened to the "profile Redirect" option? I found a great set of instructions on how to do it in Moodle 2.0, but the options seem to have disappeared from Moodle.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Course Reset does not adjust Date Restrictions
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi David, You can check whether the problem is unique to your install by trying to reproduce it on the Moodle Sandbox demo . The site resets on the hour, so you should log in just after the hour to give yourself plenty of time. If you find that the problem is indeed reproducible, please create a new tracker issue for it and link it to MDL-51467 .

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Bookmarking on the Course Section page
ResponsesInList.Text: Juanita, You can use an internal HTML anchor to do this. Put the anchor in the subsection label and then for the button add an internal href link to the anchor. For more: https://clearlydecoded.com/creating-internal-external-html-links

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Nav drawer "More.." redirect to /Course instead of /my
ResponsesInList.Text: I guess this question was asked (by me) some time ago. The conclusion was that developers chose to point to the Course overview block on /my instead of pointing to /course/index.php. It is difficult for a web application to differentiate two browsers running in the same laptop or a browser and a mobile app running in the same mobile device. How to embed this second kind of url ? 2°/ The video when embeded is too small. Is there is a way to fix the width or the height ? Regards Nara20

ResponsesInList.Title: Ang: How to embed youtube video with start and end time
ResponsesInList.Text: The auto-embed of YouTube videos only works with the regular links and not the embed links. The simplest solution would be to turn the auto-embed off at Site Administration -> Plugins -> Media players -> Manage media players, and turn it off in VideoJS aswell at Site Administration -> Plugins -> Media players -> VideoJS player. Then you can use the embed codes from Youtube, and change the height and width properties to your liking.

ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Rick, Thanks for the reply. I've added the attached diagrams to the tracker item. I hope these might help to explain the idea. ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Front page - allow selection of pages other than Dashboard or Site Home
ResponsesInList.Text: Okay, I see your desire. So, what happens if a student is in more than one course? Or at your school, is a person only allowed to be in one course?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Front page - allow selection of pages other than Dashboard or Site Home
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Rick, Most of our students are enrolled in more than one course. The desire to divert users to a customised start page is motivated by at least two main factors: 1. the lack of flexibility of the Dashboard / Site Home The more I think about it, the more surprised I am that it's currently not possible to land on a standard course page as a front page. This is the first page users encounter - especially new users - so it should be able to be customised extensively so it's welcoming, informative and a useful jumping off point to the content they need. Standard course pages provide just this capability - in contrast to the Dashboard or Site Home. For example, for the Dashboard and Site Home, without resorting to extra css or adapting code... a. some blocks can only be set to the right column and there is no built-in support for setting  columns or font size; not all blocks can be set to the centre area b. blocks available on the Dashboard or Site Home are not universally available on other pages; if they are, they can't always be placed in the centre area (; so for a block showing enrolled pages for a long term user, this ends up being a block that runs down the right margin past any existing centre content) c. if we want a list of enrolled pages that is condensed to just the links and in a small font, this is only available in user's menu > profile > course details The equivalent to this user menu list on the Site Home or Dashboard is the Course Overview. This uses space by displaying info we don't need: in the old Course Overview this was tiles; in the newer version, using the List option, this is category and completion level. 2. the variety of our user groups Our site is used as both a LMS and a staff intranet. Feedback from our users included the complaint that it wasn't clear once they'd logged in where to go to access the info they needed, and that there was info shown that wasn't relevant to them. For new users, this problem is worsened by unfamiliarity with the interface. Options available in the Dashboard or Site Home don't allow easy customising of content for these user groups: t ailoring access to individual items of content is possible by role in Site Home and Dashboard. So to use this option we'd need to create a role for each user group that would only be used on either of these two pages, and then assign each new user to one of these roles in the system context . We have around 75 user groups for 2020, not accounting for students who are in second or third years of study. Users can belong to more than one group at a time. Also, some of our students are enrolled in courses that last only a few days. So they don't have as much opportunity to get used to finding what they need. These students can be pretty much any age. Thanks, Andrew

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Front page - allow selection of pages other than Dashboard or Site Home
ResponsesInList.Text: Let me take a slightly different approach. Since your students might be in more than one course, wouldn't it be better to show students the available courses, let them pick their course of interest, have them log in if they are not yet logged in, and then take them right to the course that they picked? There is no right or wrong logic. I am just presenting an idea to you.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Front page - allow selection of pages other than Dashboard or Site Home
ResponsesInList.Text: Interesting idea! You're right - that is a different approach to the situation! A great option for when you know exactly where you want to go. With this front page change, I guess I'm thinking more on the lines of a hub page though. This could provide an initial landing point with current news, guidance for new users in where to find particular content, and a jumping off point to multiple pages. Thanks

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Front page - allow selection of pages other than Dashboard or Site Home
ResponsesInList.Text: I am not being a wiz at any of this, just offering an idea. Take a look at my Moodle frontpage . Courses are presented. My students pick their course of interest, then log in, then are taken right to the course that they picked. Maybe your students come to your Moodle saying "I have no clue which course I am going to work in, I wish the Moodle admin would decide for me."  But don't most students know what they want to study? Anyway, my Frontpage is just an example of a number of ways that Moodle shows its frontpage.  I am not doing anything special.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Front page - allow selection of pages other than Dashboard or Site Home
ResponsesInList.Text: Andrew, I think this is a valuable idea. There are some types of sites where you want to have a single, central place for users to land, a place over which you have a lot of control. Right now, the only object that could do this is a course. In business sites, having a single course into which all users are enrolled which serves as a general 'hub" or "commons" like course for all users is pretty common. I've built any number of sites like that, and the usual solution to this is to have a link on the real front page that users click to go to the hub course. Being able to automatically redirect would be very useful in such cases. (I usually add one of the auto-enrol plugins to help with this.) +1 and voted up. Randy

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Front page - allow selection of pages other than Dashboard or Site Home
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks Randy! Can I ask: when you say 'I usually add one of the auto-enrol plugins to help with this', to help with what exactly? A

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Front page - allow selection of pages other than Dashboard or Site Home
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Rick, Thanks! I like your page - food for thought. A couple of questions. 1. Yes our main students would know what page they want to go to. So if they want to go from the page they select off your front page to another, would they go back to the front page? As I noticed that you only have Home in your nav bar, and no courses listed in your top menu. 2. Do you have much experience with multiple languages in the one Moodle instance? Also noticed this selection in your top menu. Cheers, A

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Front page - allow selection of pages other than Dashboard or Site Home
ResponsesInList.Text: 1) My students would know which "course" they want to go to, yes. If a student happens to be in more than one course, they would see their other courses in the NavDrawer. Those other courses are one mouse-click away and would not even require a login. (Maybe two clicks away if the student chose to compress the NavDrawer.) Yes, you notice only a Home in my NavDraw because you are not logged in, nor are you enrolled in any courses. 2) Yes, I provide the multiple languages menu in my top Nav Bar. I haven't tracked how many students switch languages. However, I do think that some Chinese students like to make the switch, so it does happen. These multiple languages are built into Moodle, so it doesn't take much work to do what I did.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Front page - allow selection of pages other than Dashboard or Site Home
ResponsesInList.Text: If you want all users to be in a common course, you have to get them enrolled somehow. One easy way to do this is to use one of the Auto-enrol plugins so that the user is automatically enrolled in the course when the click into the link to the course. No extra admin work or pre-enrollment needed.

ResponsesInList.Title: IMO: "Announcements" could be improved
ResponsesInList.Text: Announcements can be edited, or deleted, like an activity, but cannot be added like an activity. Why not? This seems inconsistent with the way everything else in the course is done. Why can't the teacher delete individual announcements, whenever the teacher wants to do so? Maybe the teacher realizes, the next day, that an announcement was made in error. Why must you delete the entire thing, to delete one message? According to the Moodle, Announcements can be restored by setting the number of announcement to non-zero. In my experience: this does not seem to work. Why is the maximum number of Announcements set to ten? Is this way to convey, possible critical, information, prominent enough? I suspect a lot of people will just ignore the Announcement sections . If you have an announcement like: "The site will be going down in 20 minutes." Shouldn't that be more like a billboard across the top the course, instead of some dropdown list?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Adding Closed Captions to Tutorial Videos.  Captions Disappear When I upload into Moodle.

ResponsesInList.Title: Top 3 Usability Issues in a High school using Moodle

Teachers want to be able to drag Resources and Activities into a Folder. (In other words, they would like a subpage, only the subpage plugin does not work.) ResponsesInList.Title: Link a Competency to multiple Learning Plan Templates
ResponsesInList.Text: I am trying to manage a hundred+ learning plan templates. Frequently I need to add a single competency to all of the current Learning Plans or a large collection of Learning Plans. This takes hours to do manually, one-by-one. Within Competency Frameworks, I can view linked courses, but I cannot link a competency to a Learning Plan. This menu option would be so much better, if the functionality to link a competency to a learning plan option was created. That option would bring up a list of all visible learning plan templates. The user could select one or all of the learning plans templates. The save option would link all selected learning plans to the competency.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Link a Competency to multiple Learning Plan Templates
ResponsesInList.Text: That would be a great improvement. My other pet peeve is when editing the framework, if you scroll down more than one screen, the detail box with the competency information does not come with you. You have to find the competency many screens down, then scroll back up to the top to see any information about it. This is just bad basic web page design for any page. Much of competency interface system seems to come from a world where only a couple of dozen competencies and students exist. While in this world, formal competency standards for most organizations in most countries run into thousands of competencies, and there are hundreds of learning plans for thousands or tens of thousands of students.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Link a Competency to multiple Learning Plan Templates
ResponsesInList.Text: As you summarized so concisely most organizations run into thousands of competencies….and hundreds of learning plans... I agree, this part of the UI needs remodeling. I have been searching the open tickets to see if someone has already submitted a similar request.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Link a Competency to multiple Learning Plan Templates
ResponsesInList.Text: Ah, if you find such a ticket, let me know and I will upvote it and see if I can find someone to take a look at fixing it ;) From an architecture point of view, Moodle has a number of systems where bulk processes are assumed to be taken care of by external systems, like authentication, enrollments, etc. That was a sensible starting point twenty years ago when your customers are schools with existing SIS systems. Then over time, some bulk tools were added internally for those without such external SIS systems (like small schools, not-for-profits, organizations, businesses.) Standard competency sets are large and have always been large. So, it is has been a bit of a mystery why this was not a base requirement of the feature set from the start for competencies to have tools for managing large numbers of items in the UI. The LMS is the logical place to do this, too.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Link a Competency to multiple Learning Plan Templates
ResponsesInList.Text: Please vote for this tracker issue if you are managing large groups of competencies and learning plans - MDL-69237

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Link a Competency to multiple Learning Plan Templates
ResponsesInList.Text: Done! Thanks for creating that.

ResponsesInList.Title: Limit Course Visibility by Profile Field?
ResponsesInList.Text: Our organization provides customized training services to our customers, and I need to restrict visibility based on the customer's organization. Right now, I have a custom profile field OrgID that puts them in a cohort, and then I use cohort sync enrolment. This works fine, except the users need to be enrolled in all the available courses in order to see them. I'd prefer to a second tier of visibility. For example, users from Company B should never see courses built for Company A. But each Company A user should be able to see all the courses we created for them, while only being actively enrolled in a few. All suggestions appreciated!!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Limit Course Visibility by Profile Field?
ResponsesInList.Text: Got it working, but interested in feedback on better approaches. Here's what I did... 1. Define a new System role "Company A" using Authenticated User as archetype 2. Use the Cohort Role Sync plugin to get all Company A users assigned to this role (they're already in a Company A cohort) 3. Stick all the courses that are for Company A into a dedicated Category 4. In the Company A Category, add 2 permissions for the Company A User role - category:viewcourselist - course:view The users see their enrolled courses in My Courses, and they're not overwhelmed by every course they could ever use. If they want to see what else is available, they can use the "All Courses..." button on the Filtered Course List block on the dashboard .

ResponsesInList.Title: Teacher Unlock Activity
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Is there a way that a teacher can manually unlock an activity for a student. Or if someone has any other suggestion to achieve the following. The teacher does a video call pre-assessment with a student with the Big Blue Button. Only after the activity is complete does the must the student be able to do the quiz. However there is no way to prevent the Student from marking the BBB activity as complete and starting the quiz. I need the quiz to be locked until the Teacher unlocks it. Thank you.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Teacher Unlock Activity
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Deon, There are multiple ways to do this, just be creative. One possibility for all students at one time, set the quiz to Open at some future date, then remove the Open date when you are ready for the students to take the quiz. Another for all students at one time, use a quiz password and don't give it out until time to take the quiz. One possibility that will work for one student at a time. Set the Group mode for the quiz to separate groups, then add each student as you want them to be able to take the test. You can also add a Restriction requiring students to be in a certain group and then add each student as you want them to be able to take the test. There are other restrictions that could also be used.

ResponsesInList.Title: Teacher Unlock Activity
ResponsesInList.Text: Consider setting a password for the quiz, then you only need to send the password to the student in your BBB session, then they can unlock the quiz their-self.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Teacher Unlock Activity
ResponsesInList.Text: Thank you for your reply. I am gonna set a  password. More appropriate to my needs. Kind Reagrds

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Teacher Unlock Activity
ResponsesInList.Text: Great, thank you very much. That will work. Kind Regards

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Collection of flagged questions
ResponsesInList.Text: They show up in the quiz reports, but you would still have to visually scan down all the rows of the report. Or, you could do it with https://moodle.org/plugins/report_customsql , and a query like: SELECT q.name, COUNT(1) AS Number_of_attemps, SUM(WHEN qa.flagged = 0 THEN 0 ELSE 1 END) AS Number_flagged FROM mdl_quiz_attempts quiza JOIN mdl_question_usages qu ON qu.id = quiza.uniqueid JOIN mdl_question_attempts qa ON qa.questionusageid = qu.id JOIN mdl_question q

ResponsesInList.Title: Session time-out warning dialogue - could be better
ResponsesInList.Text: I keep seeing this recently, because I will be doing some development, and then leave my test Moodle open in a browser tab. Always, when I come back later, there is the popup open telling me that my session is about to expire. Obviously, by then, when I click Extend session, I then get then error telling me that my session has expired. This is silly and annoying. Clearly, how it should work is: When you get to the warning time, then the pop-up appears at present. And, if you click Extend session before it fully expires, then that also works like it does now. However (and this is the new bit) if you actually get to the time when the session expires, then the contents of the dialogue should automatically change to say that your session has expired. That could give two options, 'Log in again', or, if you have unsaved data on the current page (which, since we have form-change-checker, we can know with some convidence) there should be a 'Close dialogue' button, so you can copy-and-paste any data you want to save before you log in. Has anyone already made a tracker issue for this? If not, I will.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Session time-out warning dialogue - could be better
ResponsesInList.Text: Ah! there is alreay a tracker issue: MDL-65856 . If you agree with this, please vote.

ResponsesInList.Title: Scrolling in Reports

Just a suggestion - thank you for all the work you do, and the many improvements you've already made. Melanie

ResponsesInList.Title: To what extent is Moodle usable in Arabic
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi All. I am doing an evaluation of various LMS solutions for a client. They need an LMS that is fully functional in English, French, Portuguese, and Arabic. I need to know to what extent Moodle is usable in Arabic. I saw that 72% of Moodle has been translated into an Arabic language pack, but what does this mean? How much of Moodle will a user be unable to use because of that remaining 28% that is not available? Also, on language packs, will a separate deployment be required for every language pack? Or will users be able to simply select their language and see a different language version of the deployment? Are language packs available in Moodle Cloud ?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: To what extent is Moodle usable in Arabic
ResponsesInList.Text: I don't know about the arabic language pack, but I can make the following general points: Hundreds of registered Moodle sites in the middle east ( https://stats.moodle.org/ ), and that includes some big players like the Arab OU. Moodle has many features, most of which you won't use. And most features have obscure error messages. 72% of all strings translates can easily be 99.9% of strings anyone ever sees translated. If you hit an un-translated string that is really important for your Moodle site, you can immediately fix it in your own site using Language customisation - so you won't be stuck waiting for someone else to translate it. And, translating Moodle is a colaborative effort, so as well as fixing the translations yourself, you can contribute them back to the main project at https://lang.moodle.org/ . Regarding how this is all configured, and how it looks to users, the best thing is to get a test site, and experiment for yourself. You can start experimenting at the demo site https://qa.moodledemo.net/ which seems to have lots of languages installed. You can also read the docs at Language settings .

ResponsesInList.Title: Assign plugin feedback not expanding in Safari
ResponsesInList.Text:
Using the assign activity, whenever the teacher leaves enough feedback to a submission, the section will be contracted, but the link on the expand '+' button does not work on Safari upon page loading. However, if we execute on the console: 
```text
$('.expandsummaryicon')[0].click();
```
 The contract '-' and the expand '+' links start working normally. This behavior is found Safari for IOS as well as MacOS. On the other browsers it works as intended. Tried fixes: On the file: mod/assign/renderer.php There were 2 lines with this exact same call: 
```text
$this->page->requires->js_init_call('M.mod_assign.init_plugin_summary', $jsparams);
```
 Those were changed to this: 
```text
$this->page->requires->js_init_call('M.mod_assign.init_plugin_summary', $jsparams, true);
```
 Adding the 3rd parameter which sets the ondomready value to true. but the behavior did not change and the Safari error remains. Please help! Best regards Felice PS: To contract the feedback via JS console on the navigator, you can execute: 
```text
$('.expandsummaryicon')[1].click();
```

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Assign plugin feedback not expanding in Safari
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Felice, I've seen you've already opened MDL-68035 : I think it could be a duplicate of MDL-67442 . HTH , Matteo

ResponsesInList.Title: [3.8] - End of schoolyear, saving results and having new students
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, The school year ends in June.  In Moodle, I have a class '3 AVV A' that has lessons and tests. Next year I will have new students in this class. How do I save the results of my current students so I can review them again in for example 2 years? I want to be able to view their answers and their grades during the time they were in this class. Thank you for your help. Best regards, Thomas

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: [3.8] - End of schoolyear, saving results and having new students
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Thomas, One way is to basically create a new course for the new students and import the course files and activities through the Import function you'll find in the course management menu. Import course doesn't transfer student data, so all you copy is just the set up activities and the course layout. From 3.9 onwards (May 2020), the intention is to have a separate 'copy course' functionality. When you copy a course through the import functionality, you can set an end date or completion date on the old course, have it accessible for reference only. If you'd like to 'freeze' the course, you can use the experimental feature 'freeze context ', found in Site admin > Development.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: [3.8] - End of schoolyear, saving results and having new students
ResponsesInList.Text: Thank you for your answer Joost, Looking forward to 3.9.

ResponsesInList.Title: Queries to retrieve Statistics
ResponsesInList.Text: Dear Moodlers, I would like to find a way to retrieve the below statistics (knowing that I have consult the ad-hoc webpage and i didn't find anything related to what I need) 1. A query that will retrieve the total number of created activities (per course and per activity) during a certain period in the past (for example between January and February 2018) the exact state of Moodle at that time. 2. A query that will retrieve the total number of resources (per course) during a certain period in the past (for example between January and February 2018) the exact state of Moodle at that time. I managed to execute this query but for the current stat of Moodle, which means for example in query 1, if I run the query right now to retrieve the data between January and February 2018 it will be different if I run the same query but at that time, because a lot of activities will be deleted Below are the queries Thank you ===================================================================== Query 1: total number of activities per course per activity (SELECT c.fullname AS "Course fullname", c.idnumber AS "Course idnumber", (SELECT TABLE_NAME FROM INFORMATION_SCHEMA.TABLES WHERE TABLE_NAME like '____forum') AS ThisType, to_timestamp(act.timemodified) as DateModified, act.name AS Title FROM prefix_forum AS act INNER JOIN prefix_course AS c ON act.course=c.id) UNION (SELECT c.fullname AS "Course fullname", c.idnumber AS "Course idnumber", (SELECT TABLE_NAME FROM INFORMATION_SCHEMA.TABLES WHERE TABLE_NAME like '____assignment') AS ThisType, to_timestamp(act.timemodified) as DateModified, act.name AS Title FROM prefix_assign AS act INNER JOIN prefix_course AS c ON act.course=c.id) UNION Query 2: total number of resources per course SELECT f.contextid, c.idnumber AS "Course idnumber", c.fullname AS "Course fullname", f.filesize/1024 AS "filesize in KB", f.filename AS "filename", f.mimetype AS "filetype", to_timestamp(f.timecreated) AS "timecreated", to_timestamp(f.timemodified) AS "timemodified" FROM prefix_files f INNER JOIN prefix_context ctx ON f.contextid=ctx.id INNER JOIN prefix_course_modules cm ON ctx.instanceid=cm.id INNER JOIN prefix_course c ON cm.course=c.id WHERE (f.component='mod_folder' OR f.component='mod_resource') AND f.filesize>0

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Queries to retrieve Statistics
ResponsesInList.Text: This question is definitely not in the best forum, but still. I would not do Query 1 like that. I think the thing you should be using, but are not, is the prefix_course_modules table (joined to the prefix_module table).

ResponsesInList.Title: Group messaging: usability concerns and suggestions
ResponsesInList.Text: We are upgrading from 3.4 to 3.6, and at first glance we liked the group messaging functionality. But a fter testing it, we have discovered several issues. This is what we have found, please correct us if we have got it wrong: There is no default setting to allow group messaging on course (or system) level The course manager/teacher has to activate the ability for each group in the course. This has to be done for all groups in the course one-by-one. There is no way to change this setting in "bulk" after the groups are created It is not selectable for all groups when auto-creating groups Groups cannot be searched and added, the way single users can, in the contacts list. This might lead to: All groups that you are a member of and that have been set to allow group messaging are always visible in the IM, and this might become a very long list. When one of your groups are missing in the IM, because that group has not been allowed to group message, it will be confusing to the user. Users will try to search for the missing group (see 5 above) When a teacher needs to create additional groups, it's easy to forget to give those the group messaging ability. This will cause stress and confusion, when some students complain that they cannot find their group in the IM. Suggestions: A site-wide course default setting to set allow/disallow Group messaging when creating a course: Allow group messaging [Yes/No] A course default setting under the Course Settings: Allow group messaging [Yes/No] The setting for each group remains as it is, but is pre-set according to the choices in 1-2 above When bulk creating groups this should be an option, pre-set according to the choices in 1-2 above The setting should be indicated in the groups overview with a checkbox The setting should be able to be changed in bulk in the groups overview, by using the checkboxes and select all

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Group messaging: usability concerns and suggestions
ResponsesInList.Text: I think these are good suggestions Peter. We have Moodle 3.5 and I have turned messaging off because the controls arent tight enough. I'm hopeful that Moodle 3.6 would fix these issues, but maybe I might hold off upgrading until messaging is full fixed in the next version. (Sometimes, I wonder how much this forum is watched by Moodle UX people. I have submitted several emails now related to usability with no response.)

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Group messaging: usability concerns and suggestions
ResponsesInList.Text: Good suggestions. One thing i like about group messaging is that the context of the course is provided in the message. I feel like there should be some way to represent a student sending a private message from a course, otherwise a teacher of a number of classes with many students may not know where (or even who) it's from. I suppose i could create one big group for everyone and set up messaging but then it would all be public - what i need is for that whole course group to be "private" between members and teacher role. We have a scenario where we have advisor roles covering many courses with hundreds of students, currently using dialogue, but really messenging should be able to do the job - had hoped it would with this update in 3.6 but it's not quite there yet.

You can find it on https://tracker.moodle.org/browse/MDL-66562 and you're welcome to add any comments there. Thanks, Alex

ResponsesInList.Title: Client Self-Management Dashoard/Portal

All our courses are free and the clients we provide our courses to need their staff to gain instant access pretty much so this sync works well. What we dont have is the ability to provide a client portal for each client for them to view their staff completion status, check the courses that their staff are registered into and effectively self-manage their staff progress. It doesnt look like Edwiser comes with a 'client' portal (although it does include a 'user-account' page for students which is a start) so i'm wondering if anyone else uses wordpress and moodle, are there other plugins that could do this? If not, any suggestions on how i can possibly use moodle for this. Set up a nominated user in moodle who would have access only to staff in their organisation? I believe moodle has a parent profile. If it works the way I'm expecting, I could manually pair each staff user with the 'parent' employer but that would be a manual process and I'm trying to push for self-service solutions wherever possible since i'm the only staff member handling online learning.

ResponsesInList.Title: Searching for courses
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, I wanted to bring up Moodle's ability to let users search for courses. It seems like this would have been discussed but a forum search here was not turning up relevant results for me. Anyhow, my institution has been using a custom course block plugin that just lists all of a users courses, separated by category. I really like the new course dashboard block in Moodle 3.6+ and want to transition away from the custom course block in the future. But, I have a couple of usability questions: 1) For "regular" users like students and teachers, it seems like a search filter in the block would be a no brainer addition. Yes, they can sort by future/current/past, and star or hide courses, which is great. But often a teacher might just want to quickly jump to a specific course that doesn't happen to be displayed in their current view.. Is there a way to suggest/vote for this feature in core? 2) For admin users, the custom course block has a global course search. I hid the block on my dashboard and find myself missing this functionality. The quickest way I've found is to go to Site Admin->Courses->Manage Courses and Categories, where there is Course Search field. I tried adding this page to my Admin Bookmarks but it doesn't seem to be possible. Surely there is a quicker, built-in way to get to course search? Or should I look for another plugin.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: "Import" doesn't create sections/topics
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Anna-Maria, I don't know if the Usability forum is the best place to ask this question. A moderator may wish to move it to the backup/restore or general forum. Regarding your question: when you import a course or restore a backup, it takes the settings from the source course. If a section is hidden in the source, it will be hidden in the target. Unhiding a section should be able using the 'Edit section' menu, selecting the Show option.

ResponsesInList.Title: Moodle Content Creation Competitor

ResponsesInList.Title: Greyed-out features in a product
ResponsesInList.Text: I have recently been tasked to write/design requirements for a "lite" version of our flagship product, The "lite" version of the product would have certain product features greyed-out to the basic user, enticing them to sign up for the full membership.  I don't like the idea, was curious to hear from experts in the field on the matter.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Greyed-out features in a product
ResponsesInList.Text: Amy You are quite right not to like this idea. In particular, greyed-out items I have seen rarely pass the WCAG accessibility compliance for color contrast. They are almost always too light, since even #777 does not pass the minimum contrast required (example and nice discussion here: https://webaim.org/articles/contrast/ ). In general, the semantic use of color as the ONLY mechanism to convey information is a basic accessibility error to be avoided. Here's the official statement: "Color is not used as the only visual means of conveying information, indicating an action, prompting a response, or distinguishing a visual element." from the W3C document: https://www.w3.org/TR/WCAG21/#use-of-color . You will notice that some places in Moodle that used to have only grey-out colors to indicate hidden or other items (eg the dimmed style class), have been updated in recent versions so that they have additional text indicators to show status in addition to color; for instance, course activity items that are hidden or stealth hidden from students now do this, which is an important improvement and good practice to model. Randy

ResponsesInList.Title: EN 301 549 ver 2.2.1
ResponsesInList.Text: Is anybody analyzing this document and interested in sharing thoughts https://www.etsi.org/deliver/etsi_en/301500_301599/301549/02.01.02_60/en_301549v020102p.pdf

ResponsesInList.Title: Fordson course management panel
ResponsesInList.Text: Does anybody know how I can remove items from the course management panel in the Fordson theme? I have items on the list that refuse access to certain users, so I would like to remove them so the user doesn't know they are there. Regards Keith

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Fordson course management panel
Re: Fordson course management panel
ResponsesInList.Text: Is it just specific items or entire categories? Individual items will be much harder to do.  I suppose we might be able to build in a check but that would be a very customized setup. The entire menu for the teacher dashboard is built with this function: https://github.com/dbnschools/moodle-theme_fordson/blob/master/classes/output/core_renderer.php#L1077-L1297 You might be able to build in checks or permissions that if the user does not have them then the item disappears.  It's a bit of work do. I don't know if each item on the page has an associated permission .  This would also require you to create new system roles for the teachers or people you don't want to see certain items because you have to actually remove that permission for the role.  This could mean you have teacher A and teacher B roles. I can't promise anything but I might take a look to see if I can build in permission checks for the menu items.  I bet others would like this too. Chris

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Fordson course management panel
ResponsesInList.Text: Using this line as an example: https://github.com/dbnschools/moodle-theme_fordson/blob/master/classes/output/core_renderer.php#L1138 I am thinking you could target a role permission such as: $gradestitle = (!has_capability(' enrol/category:config ', $ context )) ? false : get_string('gradebooksetup', 'grades'); You would change the bold capability to whatever the permission is that is associated with the menu item.  That way if the user had a role that didn't have that permission it wouldn't show up.  I'm just throwing out ideas.  I am sure there might be a better way to code it. If you put a user into a role that didn't have this permission set then they would not see the gradebook item. Chris

ResponsesInList.Title: What is the best way to suggest usability improvement to Moodle?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, I was just wondering, what is the best way to discuss usability problems or suggest usability improvements to Moodle. I'm looking through the discussions here, and lot of people have great suggestions but get no response to their messages. Are they being read? Is Moodle Tracker a better way of suggesting improvements? Or is joining MUA a better way... Sorry, I'm not pointing fingers, I'm just curious... kind regards, Brad

ResponsesInList.Title: Re:
ResponsesInList.Text: I think it depends: If you spot something that is clearly bad, or if you have a specific, implementable suggestion for making something better, then it belongs in the tracker. If it is more ambiguous: something in this area but it is not clear exactly what, or something about X needs to be improved, but it is not entirely clear how, the it is probably best to find a forum to discuss it. That could be here, or MUA , or .... Once there starts to be some consensus on the specifics, then put it in the tracker.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re:
ResponsesInList.Text: On the docs ( https://docs.moodle.org/dev/Accessibility ) it points to a Accessibility Working Group: "To improve the accessibility and usability of Moodle, we have established this collaboration group to work together with Moodle developers, accessibility experts, administrators, IT professionals, and other interested entities and individuals. We welcome anyone who is interested in improving the accessibility of Moodle to join this group. You don’t need to be a technical guru or accessibility expert to join; however, it is expected that you are familiar with the basics of accessibility and are willing to dedicate a few hours each month to this collaboration effort. This group meets once a month to discuss accessibility priorities, typically on the first Monday of each month. Visit http://collaborate.athenpro.org/group/moodle to join the email list. To review past meetings or to see upcoming meetings visit http://collaborate.athenpro.org/group/moodle/teleconferences/ " But I'm not sure if it is still ongoing ...

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: What is the best way to suggest usability improvement to Moodle?
ResponsesInList.Text: In my own observations, many topics that are posted get read, but it seems to me that the major cause of not getting a reply is that the question or suggestion is confusing or too obscure. Many volunteers participate in Moodle.org (like myself) and if I see a post that is a bit off-base, sometimes I will ignore it because I don't have the time to help the poster be more specific. I only have so much time in a day. In your case with this post of yours, you can see that both Tim and Daniel have provided responses. Having said this, there are many "feature requests" in Moodle Tracker that are great ideas, but might take time to implement. In my own case, I have probably posted several dozen feature requests (let's say 36) and probably 12 have been implemented. My last feature request to get implemented took 8 years, but it then happened in Moodle 3.7. Moodle's track record, for me, has been significantly better than the other LMSs (BB, D2L, C) that I have used. Piggybacking on what Tim said, I would agree, I sometimes start here in Moodle.org with a post, kind of like fishing and testing the waters, then I will post in Tracker. If something looks like a bug, I post in Tracker and follow-up here in these forums. In Tracker, if something about my idea is out of place, Tracker has the ability to "close" an item. I believe that posts here in these forums last a very long time.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: What is the best way to suggest usability improvement to Moodle?
ResponsesInList.Text: Thank you everyone for your replies. I want to get more involved in supporting usability improvements to Moodle so there is a lot of food for thought there..

ResponsesInList.Title: Dragging Files Resources into a Folder Resource
ResponsesInList.Text: I saw this was a previous forum topic and I think it still applies today as it did then. I strongly believe users should be able to drag File Resources into Folders, and in fact many teachers at my school have complained that they cant. It's not enough, to simply look for a Course Format like Flexible Sections or Sub courses to be able to help avoid the Scroll of Death, or to rely on the File Picker to move files into folders. It should be core functionality. cheers, Brad

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Dragging Files Resources into a Folder Resource
ResponsesInList.Text: This would be super useful. Creating a folder by dragging a file over another file would be great too.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Dragging Files Resources into a Folder Resource
ResponsesInList.Text: I do like the idea of dragging a file over another file to create a folder, but I could see some issues when it comes to moving files around the screen. You could accidentally drop it on another file by mistake.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Dragging Files Resources into a Folder Resource
ResponsesInList.Text: I was thinking actually, that the flexible sections format and folder functionality really should be combined. A folder really should just be a collection of activities and resources, that users can simply drag items into so to group things. I know the Topics tabs are there for that reason, but I feel a user should not be so constrained - they should be able to group things into different hierarchical levels if that is their desire. And folders/sections should be able to sit anywhere on any page. The process should be: Create a folder (a flexible section closed) Drag labels, resources and activities into the folder Go into the folder, and repeat the last two steps if necessary.. This will put an end to the scroll of death. In many ways the flexible sections format simply needs to be upgraded to look like a folder, with better drag and drop enabled especially if the section/folder is closed. just some thoughts..

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Dragging Files Resources into a Folder Resource
ResponsesInList.Text: Yeah, well said - I would think a visual helper or delay would help prevent accidentally dropping something in (a little like the Mac finder's pop up folders)

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Dragging Files Resources into a Folder Resource
ResponsesInList.Text: Ive been giving this some more thought, the number of teachers who have come up to me to ask how to group their resources is quite astounding. We have over 200 teachers and I think about 20 of them have asked about it. Particularly teachers who have placed a large number of links on their page. They dont want to create a new Section, they simply want to be able to group their resources in something similar to a Folder . And they dont like the look of the Flexible Sections format at present - it also isn't compatible with Sharing Cart. If Moodle doesnt want to change the Folder resource - as in keep it only for Files that's okay. But perhaps creating a Collection resource which can be used to contain any group of Resources or Activities. I think it would be a very simple addition to core functionality. The Collection could either open on the page dynamically or go to its own page. If users could drag their Resources and Activities into the Collection, that would great. It could also be a very easy way to move multiple resources around the page. When I have time, I might create a Moodle Tracker for this.

ResponsesInList.Title: Repository Documentation
ResponsesInList.Text: Greetings developers, Your software has been both a blessing and an absolute nightmare. First of all, as my two cents, advertising 3.6 as a stable edition is incorrect as it is lacking even the most basic site administration features. Regardless, I wish to access files that are within the server storage without having to upload them especially considering the upload limit. Every other edition has ways to do this, however, within the documentation there is no mention of the "create repository instance function", only what the final product would look like. While I am here, I would also like to ask for native microphone support for quizzes along with an ability to allow guests to at least preview quizzes to get a taste of what our setup has to offer, Thank you, Anhad

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Repository Documentation
ResponsesInList.Text: I’ve just checked the date and it’s past noon on 1st April so I assume you’re being serious. So... Which site administration features is Moodle lacking? The server files repository is well documented at https://docs.moodle.org/36/en/Server_files_repository . In addition there are many other repository options in core and number of additional repository plugins. Guest access to quizzes is documented here: https://docs.moodle.org/36/en/Quiz_FAQ#Why_can.27t_people_.28guests.29_attempt_a_quiz_without_creating_an_account_and_logging_in.3F From Moodle 3.5 onwards, you can record video and audio directly within the editing interface, and there are also a range of plugins that allow this.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Repository Documentation
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello, Thank you for the quick response. I had a look at that page and could find nothing on how the folders are to be linked or associated with the server directory. I am running moodle on Ubuntu 16.04 and did indeed try to create a folder called "repository" within the moodledata folder along with giving it ample permissions. However, when I try to add an audio file to a question from "server files", all I can see is the folder "System". To reiterate, I wish to add files from the server command line to be able to interface with in the moodle software. As for the audio, my apologies, I meant to specify for the students to be able to record audio when answering a quiz. Thank you for your response, Anhad

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Repository Documentation
ResponsesInList.Text: So, as I said, the text editor in Moodle has allowed students to record audio directly via the browser since v3.5. In addition, plugins such as Poodll allow this too. Poodll offers more flexibility in my opinion: see https://poodll.com/audio-assessments/ and https://poodll.com/poodll-recorders-vs-moodle-recorders/ For the respository, if you’ve set up the file system repo properly, it should show as a separate instance in the repo list; you wouldn’t access it via server files. See the image in this section of the docs , which shows the file system repo in the section called, in that example, Faculty (File system) . D o you mean you wish to be able to search for and upload/link files already on your server? The file system repo allows you to put files into that directory and be visible to all users who have permission in Moodle - kind of like a virtual drive . I suspect you’re maybe wanting something a bit different, possibly akin to the Dropbox or Google drive functionality. There is a WebDAV repo, which may work for you. See https://docs.moodle.org/36/en/Repositories

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Help Desk activity?
ResponsesInList.Text:
There was a plugin for a help desk - https://moodle.org/plugins/block_helpdesk - but it’s not been updated since Moodle version 2.5 and almost certainly won’t work with v3.6 but it might

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Help Desk activity?
ResponsesInList.Text: In my university courses, with students, I provide one bonus point whenever a student is the first one to report any administrative problem to me.  They can email me, or they can post to any of the general "I need help with this topic" forums.  It doesn't matter to me how they do it. This system seems to work.  Some students will pay very close attention to everything that I make available to them, looking for an error.  Bonus points add up, and they can accumulate to be worth around 2% of their overall grade, sometimes enough to pop them into the next grade category. In your case, whatever you do, think about some incentive that you might provide for your users to be rewarded for reporting problems.  Make it easy (like my email approach).  I don't prioritize, I just fix problems immediately so that no other student will see them. Oh, I will add the fancy words... This is my way of implementing "continuous improvement."

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Help Desk activity?
ResponsesInList.Text: There is a user support tracker plugin for Moodle available at https://moodle.org/plugins/mod_tracker However, if you click on the link for versions, you see it is listed as being for Moodle 3.0 and lower. Another HOWEVER, if you go to the source code at github, https://github.com/vfremaux/moodle-mod_tracker you will see that if you click the drop down for the branch list, there are the versions you need for all the latest  versions of Moodle. You just need to be aware that you will also need to down load and install a corresponding version of vflibs from https://github.com/vfremaux/moodle-local_vflibs ...back-end functionality like prioritizing and tracking the status (open/in progress/review pending/etc.) It is all available in this plugin. Been using it since Moodle 1.9 days. Works great!

ResponsesInList.Title: Adding new topics to TOP of course

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Adding new topics to TOP of course
ResponsesInList.Text: If you momentarily click on the drag and drop icon, it will show you a list of topics and you can then select the top one. If you are using the Collapsed Topics course format, you can click Close All and then drag Sections into a new order. There’s also the Weekly format reversed course format, but unfortunately not reversed topics.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Adding new topics to TOP of course
ResponsesInList.Text: I like the Collapsed Topics approach.  It's really fast!

ResponsesInList.Title: Parents viewing a Child's course and Assignment Dates
ResponsesInList.Text: Most schools would want their Parents to know the due dates of their children's assignment and yet this functionality seems missing from Moodle. I've been thinking about this problem, and the easiest solution would be to create a course Enrolment Method called Mentees. If enabled on a Course, then for each student, their mentee is automatically enrolled as an Observer Role with minimal permissions and are placed in a Course Group called Mentees. This would also give the ability to provide course specific activities to parents, such as a Parental Consent Form (which would just be a Feedback Form restricted to parents). Or to email a group of parents. It also allows the Teacher or Manager to decided if they want parents to be able to access their site or not. cheers, Brad

This would simply be the Policy functionality extended to a Course level. If Parents could be enrolled as an Observer group, then it allows teachers to easily email parents when they wish.

ResponsesInList.Title: RopeTeam Course Format?
ResponsesInList.Text: I am not sure how many of us report bugs via the tracker, but doing so might have some unexpected benefits.  I happen to stumble across this this morning and was greatly encouraged about where Moodle is going: https://tracker.moodle.org/browse/MDL-58419 https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1BVdLjIQ7qf4o6B5A10fJhOvjmSg_ESStKiju5j4ng_4/edit#slide=id.p This is the sort of out of the box, innovative thinking Moodle needs.  Course format in particular, in Moodle, has a very dated look and often has too much going on, distracting the learner from the learning task.  It is a classic case of software getting in the way. The rope team course format addresses this problem for both learner and course facilitator/writer. I hope this one makes it into production soon!

ResponsesInList.Title: Proper names capitalisation in Moodle
ResponsesInList.Text: If I search for e.g. for "results block" I find "Add a new activity results block" & "The Activity results block only shows data stored in other locations." The same happens for many other names ( activities , blocks, etc). I don't think both are correct. Reading the entry for "Proper noun" in Wikipedia I have understood that proper nouns are distinguished from common nouns using a capitalised first letter. In the case of  single-word names, this is quite easy and most english people agree and more or less use the rule. For multiword proper names though, there are some doubts (only first letter of first word or first letters of all words). The problem starts when people that give a name, use it for so long that they come to think it is now part of the language i.e. common. But for a newcomer these words look strange or jargon. To be fair we need to be objective and have in mind as many users as possible. Power or long time users would have no problem either way. Most users would sooner or later discover the rule if it is applied uniformly. New users would very easily be instructed that names of things in Moodle have a first letter (or first letter of every word) capitalised. And that would help them a lot. My point of view is that of a translator so I can assert that it would be a tremendous help in many doubious strings in every language. p.s. I am not sure if I explained everything right. Sorry for any mistakes!

ResponsesInList.Title: Απάντηση: Proper names capitalisation in Moodle
ResponsesInList.Text: I think Moodle used to capitalise all word first letters in the past but later changed the rule to almost no capitalisation at all.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Proper names capitalisation in Moodle
ResponsesInList.Text: Almost all text in Moodle should be Sentence case. This has been the rule for a very long time. No recent changes.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Proper names capitalisation in Moodle
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks for your response! I am happy to see that you use a capital "S" to refer to Sentence case. As I read in https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/sentence_case it means "the first letter uppercase and subsequent letter lowercase with exceptions such as proper nouns or acronyms". I am referring to the exception of proper nouns. If e.g. I create a new type of block and I name it "Exceptional New Grades" how should the following message refer to it? Add a new "Exceptional New Grades" block. Add a new Exceptional New Grades block. Add a new Exceptional new grades block. Add a new exceptional new grades block. In other words, why is "The Activity results..." using a capital "A"? And why is "Add a new activity..." using a small "a"? (from the forum's description)

ResponsesInList.Title: File content display on grading
ResponsesInList.Text: When a student submits a document in response to an Assignment it will display the content of the document on the screen if the document is either a pdf or doc type. If in addition to the pdf of doc another type of file was uploaded by the student , the system will show that it is trying to generate a display but eventually will show a blank screen. Until last year this did not happen. if two files were uploaded by the student, for example one pdf file and the other an image file, the system ignored the non pdf one and displayed the pdf content correctly. This is a critical issue. For example an assignment may require a report (pdf or doc type) and also an image or software code file. Until the last version the report was displayed correctly. Now the only way to read the report is to download it to the local computer and than opening it. This is a time consuming task and there is no way annotate the document if you don't have the correct software. Is there a solution to this issue, or will this be corrected in next version?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: File content display on grading
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Ofer, From the description you have provided, it seems to me neither of the two provided Document converters is set up and working correctly on your site. Go to Site administration > Plugins > Document converters > Manage document converters.  I Unoconv or Google drive Enabled? Go to Unoconv Settings. Is there a green checkmark beside the box for the Path to unoconv document converter? Click the link for Test unoconv path. Is it configured properly? Click the link for Download the converted pdf test file. Are you able to see the PDF? If you are not using Unoconv, are you using Google Drive instead? For it to work you must have OAuth 2 service working. And, you can then test if it is working properly. Without one of the two converters being properly set up and working, the problem you describe will continue to exist.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: #anchor in links
ResponsesInList.Text: I found the solution: Add course-header to moodle\theme\remui\classes\output\core\course_renderer.php // Display link itself. $activitylink = html_writer::empty_tag('img', array('src' => $mod->get_icon_url(), 'class' => 'iconlarge activityicon', 'alt' => ' ', 'role' => 'presentation')) . html_writer::tag('span', $instancename . $altname, array('class' => 'instancename p-10 font-weight-400 text-blue')); if ($mod->uservisible) { $output .= html_writer::link($url . "#course-header" , $activitylink, array('class' => $linkclasses, 'onclick' => $onclick)); } else { // We may be displaying this just in order to show information // about visibility, without the actual link ($mod->is_visible_on_course_page()). $output .= html_writer::tag('div', $activitylink, array('class' => $textclasses)); } return $output; }

ResponsesInList.Title: Auto Enroll in a Course dependent on other course completions
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi all, I'm trying to come up with a solution to this. We have one moodle instance that has multiple courses. We have one course that is meant to be "unlocked" after students have completed the previous courses. This final course contains a course evaluation and custom certificate. We have the auto enrollment plugin on the other courses so that teachers do not need to approve enrollments. However, because we want the course evaluation & certificate to be dependent on the other course completions, we do not want active auto enroll for that course. I'm trying the Course completed enrolment plugin (moodle site seems to be having some issues at the moment), but I'm noticing that it doesn't seem to "automatically enroll" the students into the course - the teacher would still need to approve. I'm not too familiar with learning plans or groupings, would this be an easier/more reliable way to achieve this? Thanks in advance for your help! Sarah Ruth

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Auto Enroll in a Course dependent on other course completions
ResponsesInList.Text: Learning plans are not for enrollment. Learning plans "track" competencies that are awarded for activity/course completions. Did you research if cohort sync could be a possible solution?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Auto Enroll in a Course dependent on other course completions

The caveat is that the client wants students to go through the courses as "automatically" as possible, meaning the managers of the courses want to spend the least amount of time managing the courses (meaning approving enrollment, etc). The only management they want is pulling reports. If they have to, they will have to as that's how Moodle is designed as I understand it? But, if there are options that I'm not aware of, I just thought to ask. Thanks again! Sarah Ruth

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Restrict access
ResponsesInList.Text: It is possible I do not fully understand your set-up, but it should be quite straightforward. Setup your course with three activities . Activity 1: Module 1 - SCORM content 1 Activity 2: Module 2 - SCORM content 2 (Restrict Access condition = student must view Module 1) Activity 3 = your certificate (Restrict Access condition = student must view Module 1 and Module 2) The only problem that comes to mind, it what "completion" rule was used on the SCORM content file. All slides view = completed, number of slides = completed or a % complete grade? Best Regards, Shirley

ResponsesInList.Title: Letting faculty remove multiple sections easily
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello, I found this excellent discussion about the changes to add/remove topics/sections . Fortunately, faculty now have a way to automatically add multiple sections at once. However, we set up course to default to a weekly format with 16 sections. Previously, faculty could easily change to a topics format with even zero sections, if that worked better for their class needs. Now, going from 16 weeks to zero topics is a HUGE pain. Even going from 16 weeks to a more standard five topics is a big pain. This strikes me as a big issue and a bug. I see the reasoning for taking the number of topics/sections out of the course admin area ( https://tracker.moodle.org/browse/MDL-57769 ). However, I don't think that the current remedy is suitable. I know there are a number of trackers addressing this issue. However, I did not see an open issue to address the difficulty in adjusting the number of sections down. Granted, having to few sections is worse than having too many. However, too many sections are ugly and possibly confusing to students. Should I create a new tracker, or is there one I can vote up?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Can I change the font if using markdown editor?
ResponsesInList.Text: Using Atto, you can do it manually. Click on Show/hide advanced buttons and the last button on the bottom row. Use an inline style tag to make it work, for example: This font is bigger This font is bigger AFAIK , the current limitations of Atto don't allow for an easy change in size. Of course you may choose to swap editors to TinyMCE, but I don't know how much longer that is going to be supported in Moodle.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Allowing non site admins to upload bigger files
ResponsesInList.Text: .....And have found my problem and fixed it.  This has to do with the course (that specific one) being a legacy course.  We have been using moodle since 1.9 and some of the older courses were backed up and hammered...errr.. restored into the  new version 3.4. All works fine with those but for some reason, the course settings had a 2MB limit on the course, so I went to Course Administration> Edit Settings and scrolled down to Files and Uploads to change the value to the desired one . I hope this helps somebody else. Although I guess my site is one of the few with legacy courses forced into a new version. J.Guzman

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: subject without teachers
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Selma, unfortunately, you have not provided much information about you Moodle. Version, theme, and so on will often have an impact onhow you can retrieve information about your courses. In the most simple case, you may be able to generate such a report from the database if you install the adhoc report plugin from the OU. If this is not possible and you have phpMyAdmin or some other query tool to search your database, then you will need to build a query using that tool. The database has changed significantly since the last time I have done anything like this so I don't know which tables you might need to define connections for building such queries. Someone in the Developer's forums should be able to provide more information.

ResponsesInList.Title: Unzipping uploaded files moodle file activity
ResponsesInList.Text: Greetings, We have Moodle 3.4, and we created a course, then add a file activity, then we drag and drop a zipped file into this activity, and then we need to unzip it. But when I click the unzip button, nothing happened. Please advise!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Unzipping uploaded files moodle file activity
ResponsesInList.Text: Yes, that is likely. It is my understanding that SCORM files are uploaded this way, but that is all. The file itself is it an entire course file or just a single page of text, text and images, text, images and multimedia files? If it is just a text file, unzip it, then upload it or copy and paste. If it is text and images, or text, images and multimedia, can't help you there. Unless you want to, in your course, create a page, add an image and/or multimedia files, back it up and then download it. Change the download file type to zip and unzip it. Use this file as a shell, changing the xml code as required. Zip it up and change the file type to mbz, then restore.  (This used to be simple but since v2.0, it is not as easy as it used to be but the security restrictions should be able to be gotten around, look for the patterns for file linking.) If it is an entire course, and it has all the Moodle required xml files, in place, change the file type to mbz and upload it as a restore. There is probably an easier way of doing this, but I don't know it, based on the little information provided.
