ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks John, I'll check those out. I went through the Moodle directory and emailed a few of the largest Moodle sites in the USA to ask them as well; hopefully someone is kind enough to weigh in. I'll post anything useful

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Best video format & software for mobile user (iphone) compatibility
ResponsesInList.Text: I didn't know there was another moodle forum. Has USA got their own ? I thought they were all here.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Best video format & software for mobile user (iphone) compatibility
ResponsesInList.Text: I may not have been clear there; I went to moodle's listing of the largest US sites, then actually went to those sites and personally emailed the admins asking for their help. Not a great chance of hearing back but exactly the people who would know best.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Best video format & software for mobile user (iphone) compatibility
ResponsesInList.Text: Tom, IMHO there is no one format which will play on all browsers / operating systems with the native HTML5 player. However your closest match would be MP4 format. As far as I know MP4 will play as HTML5 video on all bar Firefox ... Firefox needs Webm or Ogg Theora Vorbis... https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Supported_media_formats There is of course another caveat... iOS devices have a very specific requirement for how your MP4 has been encoded... In a nutshell it must be encoded with the Baseline Level 3.0 https://developer.apple.com/library/ios/documentation/NetworkingInternet/Conceptual/StreamingMediaGuide/FrequentlyAskedQuestions/FrequentlyAskedQuestions.html In all honesty I gave up trying to get a locally encoded piece of video to work in all devices with the HTML5 video plugin and just went back to using YouTube and letting Google sort out the format for different devices! Jon

ResponsesInList.Title: How do I embed schemes made with Dia Diagram Editor?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hallo, I would like to use the open source software 'Dia Diagram Editor' (from: http://dia-installer.de/index.html.en ) to create diagrams, arrow charts etc. Does someone know how to import such a diagram into a Moodle-page? In which Moodle-block can I embed such a vector diagram? Thanking you in advance for your answer, I remain, Rges www.cper.org

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: How do I embed schemes made with Dia Diagram Editor?
ResponsesInList.Text: That is more of a dia/web question than Moodle. Unless you absolutely must have vector display the easiest option is to export in a bitmap, it will do  png. If you must have vector then probably the most common format is svg. If you want to manipulate the svg further then you might import it into inkscape and manipulate it further. http://dia-installer.de/doc/en/loadsave-chapter.html#loadsave-filetypes-import My last suggestion is don't use Dia, it is limited and has not moved on in a very long time. Although it was not designed specifically for this you might be as well off using the drawing tool in OpenOffice.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: How do I embed schemes made with Dia Diagram Editor?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hallo Marcus, Thank you for your advice. I have now installed OpenOffice 4.1.1 (I see that Oracle is no longer the owner, but Apache ). I will start experimenting with OO-Daw. Regards, Rges

ResponsesInList.Title: Course management usability
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi! We're revising some aspects of usability in the Site administration menu. We've seen that Restore course link is added in this section, and we think it could be nice to add "Add a new course" link the same way "Add a category" is. Also we think that " Upload courses" and "Upload users" (CSV feature) have to change their text. We have many users failing to restore course through this links, because they are uploading mbz files instead of csv. We recommend to change the text by Upload bulk users/courses or something similar, in order to reduce this errors. Otherwise, We also recommend to review all the restore vs import texts. When you try to restore a new course, the first section ask you to import a backup file... and there are many things like this. Import is always aiming to import activities while restore is used to restore backups. But the user is not alsways thinking about restoring a backup, many times the user is thinking abou importing a course they downloaded for free from another website... What do you think about that? Cheers! Pau

ResponsesInList.Title: unexpected token errors
ResponsesInList.Text: My server is a Windows 2008 R2 64 bit server running WAMP and Moodle 2.8.1+ (build 20141224) We have the google drive api running and have it set up and working.   The issue we are having is when students try to upload a file from their google drive.  If the file is created in google docs it succeeds but when they try to upload a file that they have copied to their google drive that was created in a different program it fails with an "syntax error json parse error unrecognized token '>'  " message. ResponsesInList.Title: Re: unexpected token errors
ResponsesInList.Text: I am not sure why you get those errors - but most likely it's caused by your Windows 2008 server configuration. IIS documentation has some server settings that could have some effect https://docs.moodle.org/28/en/Internet_Information_Services but your site is running WAMP so it's not exactly the same environment. I would start from Site administration > Server > HTTP and untick the Slash Arguments selection

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: unexpected token errors
ResponsesInList.Text: Thank you for the assistance.  I was beginning to think I was way out in left field. I have made that change and will test it.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: unexpected token errors
ResponsesInList.Text: Unfortunately we are still getting the same error.  Is there anything else I can try?  Or anywhere else I can look to try to more closely delineate the problem? Thanks

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: unexpected token errors
ResponsesInList.Text: I tested uploading a Word docx-file to Google Docs and indeed uploding it from Google Drive repository to moodle's file picker failed. The file type was changed to rtf so it was no more the original docx file in Google Docs. As you said a similar file created in Google Docs (rtf) could be uploaded to moodle through the same repository in a second. The problem might as well be in the process that Google Docs is using to convert documents to new format (some unsuitable code inside the converted documents) - I tried renaming the test file and editing the file in Google Docs but it did not help. Still those uploaded files can be opened ok in Google Docs. Your students could of course upload the original files from USB-sticks, hard disk or other repositories using file picker directly to moodle (if they have the original files) - without the Google Drive repository plugin. Core developers might be able to help if you want to create a new bug issue to tracker https://tracker.moodle.org

ResponsesInList.Title: Is It Possible To Do More Than Just Courses and Exams with Moodle?
ResponsesInList.Text: Is it possible to use Moodle to allow students to do something other than review courses, take exams, etc? For example, one part of my site will allow students to set goals.  In order to do this, they must set an overall goal, then determine how to reach this goal.  They will then set up numerous sub-goals (with even more under these - as many goals, sub-goals, and levels of goals as necessary) to help them reach their main overall goal. Is it possible to set this up in a way in which they could come back periodically and review the goals they previously set?  They will need to check off completed goals, review and update future goals, make notes about previously achieved goals, etc.  This will not require a time frame in which to work, nor exams, grading, or many other things associated with normal coursework/ Moodle. This is just one of a number of things of this nature that I can see as being beneficial to my students, so this would be a great feature to have for my site. If you need any more information, please feel free to ask.  I'm typing this at 11:30 at night, so I'm pretty sure I'm leaving out vital information.  Thanks for any help that you may be able to offer! Michael

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Is It Possible To Do More Than Just Courses and Exams with Moodle?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello, there is https://docs.moodle.org/28/en/Course_completion But the conditions is fot the course to complete, not user specific, and the teacher is the person who usually do this although you can give the permissions to students to do this. There is also https://docs.moodle.org/28/en/Rubrics But again, it is kind of thing the teacher may for stablish for activities , although you can give the permissions to students to do this, you would end up having to create one activity for each user A non standard approach is https://moodle.org/plugins/view.php?plugin=block_xp That adds points, levels and rankings. Again, this is all configured by the teacher, for the entire course, You may be interested in this too: https://docs.moodle.org/28/en/Game_Logic_in_Moodle_Overview Finally, maybe you could think about kanban ( https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kanban ) with https://taiga.io/ that is a far better tool/approach to track projects than use moodle =) Just some ideas, hope you like =) Kind regards, Daniel

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Is It Possible To Do More Than Just Courses and Exams with Moodle?
ResponsesInList.Text: That is a lot of information!  Thank you! I will be sure to check out everything mentioned, and thanks for the hint on the Taiga software.  I'll check that out, as well.

ResponsesInList.Title: Nested Fieldsets
ResponsesInList.Text: An accessibility report on one of our sites raised the issue that it had a number of nested fieldsets (for example, when creating a new event, the start date time control is in a fieldset inside the general fieldset). While this is valid HTML, it is not handled well by screen readers (from my research and testing with NVDA). Now the date and date time mform selector is not very accessible (there is no accessible structural connection between the label and the form entry fields) and I was wondering what the approach should be to fix this. My first thought is to make the label the legend for the fieldset, but as screen readers don't handle it well, it's not a great improvement. Another thought is to make it labelled by multiple controls, but again that isn't handled well by screen readers. The question becomes, should we work towards valid uses (and wait for screen readers to catch up - I'm not sure how well they can do this) or work towards something that screen readers can support now (and I'm not sure what this is yet)?

ResponsesInList.Title: Myer-Griggs type personality tests
ResponsesInList.Text: I am a newbie to Moodle.  I selected it based on it's reputation and am glad I did. I have built a course based around personal skills and personality evaluation.  Because there are no right/wrong answers in such a course normal grading is inadequate. I have designed a very simple, generic, solution to this problem which would work with multiple-choice, matching or true-false quiz types.  It involves creating a couple of reference only tables and adding a group field to the answers table. Nothing changes as far as the user is concerned and only a small amount of programming is required to make it work. I'm not a programmer so I would need someone make this a reality. Is anyone interested in such a project?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Myer-Griggs type personality tests
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Miles, I could not leave you without an answer entirely, but please, do not feel ignored or unsupported here. What you propose sounds like a good idea, but the problem is that there are not that many people in these forums who do that much coding. Many do not know anything about coding, or are not interested in it. Most, I suspect, are like me, have little or no idea about PHP, but know something about coding, and will tinker with their Moodles, and other PHP apps they use, but there are very few full time developers. Those who are, are usually too busy to help with such a project. The tinkerers knowledge ranges from little to lots, and can usually give good advice on how to do some things, but they do not trust their own project development skills, and often with good reasons. Perhaps your best bet would be to continue your design work and start the basic structural work yourself. As you learn more, and start to learn what questions you need to ask, there are plenty of people here, and elsewhere, who could help with specific advice, even if not the actual coding, in the Developers Forum. There are also other forums where tutorials and further support for PHP- MySQL / PostGres app developers can be found, I am sure. You might want to start with the Zend forums. Good luck and I hope it works for you...

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Myer-Griggs type personality tests
ResponsesInList.Text: https://docs.moodle.org/28/en/Questionnaire_Personality_test

ResponsesInList.Title: quiz - with session keep alive
ResponsesInList.Text:
I was doing a 2 hour quiz recently in full screen the pop-up mode and my session timed out. When I clicked the next button after spending a very long time typing text and completing the task on the page I was left with only some debug info on the screen. This was a v2.6.1 so no autosave and I lost everything I had typed. Not good !!!! This is hack will let you run a quiz with very long tasks while maintaining a short session time out. While the quiz attempt pages are open it keeps the users session alive - forever. Once the quiz has ended the session will timeout as normal. This is for quiz mod v2.8.1 but easy to get working on older versions. Copy the attached files to mod/quiz, flush your cache and the go to : Site administration -> Activity
modules -> Quiz -> quiz | keepalive To activate session keep alive tick the box and save. You will see a security warning at the top of your quiz. Also a good idea to make sure autosave is turned on. The keep-alive is set for 4 mins so even the shortest 5min session timeout should not timeout. If anyone shows interest I may add a select box so the user can set the ping time. Longer is better.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: quiz - with session keep alive
ResponsesInList.Text: Just a warning to people who might use this: When the install instructions say " Copy the attached files to mod/quiz " - this will overwrite some of the standard Moodle files, which will cause problems the next time you try to upgrade. Colin, I think you could implement your change as a self-contained plugin, if you wanted to make it easier or safer for people to use: https://docs.moodle.org/dev/Quiz_access_rules . However, just turning on autosave is almost as good as this change for keeping the session alive, and it also autosaves.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: quiz - with session keep alive
ResponsesInList.Text: Yes the quiz I was doing was moodle 2.6 so there was no autosave. When my session timed out I was just left with a popup screen with debug info. The debug screen in a popup will be very confusing for many users. If you turn autosave on does it keep the users session alive if they do not type anything ?

ResponsesInList.Title: Show alphabet filter in grader report regardless of number of student
ResponsesInList.Text: This is related to tracker - https://tracker.moodle.org/browse/MDL-48610 The alphabet filter at the top of the grader report page is very useful. However, it only appears when the list of students spans across two pages; if all students are able to fit on one page (e.g. if you set assignments per page to 100 and there are only 90 students to show) then the user is unable to benefit from alphabet filter. Is anyone able to suggest a patch for this please?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Show alphabet filter in grader report regardless of number of student
ResponsesInList.Text:
You need to be looking in lib/tablelib.php. Search in there for 'initial' to see all the relevant code. If you are interested, you can try to work it out for yourself. If you want a spoiler: https://github.com/moodle/moodle/blob/8f06fffbe117b91bc0c36c78a25210c994fb0a20/lib/tablelib.php#L1444 Change 
```text
$this
->
initialbars(
$grandtotal
 
>
 
$pagesize
);
```
 to 
```text
$this
->
initialbars(
true
);
```

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Show alphabet filter in grader report regardless of number of student
ResponsesInList.Text: Tim, thank you very much for this

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Show alphabet filter in grader report regardless of number of student
ResponsesInList.Text: I have been advised to ask forums users to vote for this fix on the open tracker ( https://tracker.moodle.org/browse/MDL-48610 ). If this suggestion becomes popular then they will integrate it. T

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Show alphabet filter in grader report regardless of number of student
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello, i've voted for the issue =) as I agree that is better for consistency and also "less code is better". Kind regards, Daniel

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Macrons and Atto editor
ResponsesInList.Text: Kia ora Narissa, I'm not sure what you're referring to but if you need a tool to type with macrons you can download the Polynesian Keyboard for PC or Mac. Here's the address: http://www.huri-translations.pf/english/polynesian-keyboard.html . Also, I heard people were looking for qualified translators to translate Moodle in Māori. Have you heard anything about it? Tamatoa

ResponsesInList.Title: "Go to message" link on Moodle.org
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello, don't know exactly if it is a theme's thing or a general behaviour, but: * When i log in to Moodle.org and have a message to see, if I "Ctrl+click" on the link to open in a new tab, it does not respect the behaviour, redirecting the same tab to messages page. It is a little annoying and if people are suffering from this too i can help fix =) Kind regards, Daniel
